intro: Ouratea dissitiflora, commonly known as the clustered ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an understory plant in humid, shaded forest environments. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that releases seeds when mature.
